scenarios.title: No Internet Connection
scenarios.description: I can't access the internet at all

scenarios.title: Can't Connect to WiFi
scenarios.description: I can't connect to the wireless network

scenarios.title: Can't Access Specific Websites
scenarios.description: Some websites won't load but others work

scenarios.title: VPN Not Working
scenarios.description: I can't connect to the company VPN

scenarios.title: Email Problems
scenarios.description: I can't send or receive emails

scenarios.title: Can't Access Shared Files
scenarios.description: I can't access network drives or shared folders

scenarios.title: Computer Says 'No Internet Access'
scenarios.description: Connected but showing no internet or limited connectivity

scenarios.title: Website is Blocked
scenarios.description: I get a blocked or security warning when accessing sites

scenarios.title: Can't Login to Computer/Network
scenarios.description: Login fails or password not working

scenarios.title: Network Device is Offline
scenarios.description: Router, switch, or access point shows offline

q1.text: First, let's check the basics. Can you see any websites at all, or is nothing loading?

options.text: Some things work, but not everything

q2.text: Are other people in your office or home having the same problem?

q3.text: This looks like a network-wide issue. Can you check if the router/modem has lights on?

q4.text: Try unplugging the router and modem, wait 30 seconds, then plug them back in. Does internet come back after 2-3 minutes?

q5.text: Just your device has the problem. Are you using WiFi or a cable (Ethernet)?

q6.text: Can you check if the cable is firmly plugged into both your computer and the wall/router?

q7.text: Try unplugging the cable and plugging it back in. Also try a different port on the wall/router if possible. Does it work now?

q50.text: Everything is slow. Is it slow for everyone in your office/home, or just you?

q51.text: Are people streaming videos, downloading large files, or on video calls right now?

q52.text: This might be an issue with your internet provider. Try restarting your router (unplug for 30 seconds). Does speed improve?

q53.text: Do you have many programs or browser tabs open right now?

q54.text: If you're on WiFi, try moving closer to the router. Does it get faster?

q100.text: Let's troubleshoot your WiFi. Can you see your WiFi network in the list of available networks?

q101.text: When you try to connect, what happens?

options.text: It says 'Can't connect' or similar error

q102.text: Do you know the correct WiFi password? (It might be on a sticker on the router)

q102a.text: Are you sure you're typing it exactly right? WiFi passwords are case-sensitive (Capital letters matter).

q103.text: Try 'forgetting' the network and reconnecting fresh. On your device, find the WiFi settings, tap your network, and choose 'Forget'. Then reconnect. Does it work now?

q110.text: You can't see your WiFi network at all. Can you see ANY other WiFi networks nearby?

q111.text: Your WiFi might be hidden or the router might be off. Can you check if the router is powered on and has lights?

q112.text: Is WiFi turned on on your device? (Check for a WiFi switch or airplane mode)

q150.text: Your WiFi keeps dropping. How often does it disconnect?

q151.text: Is your router near a microwave, baby monitor, or cordless phone? These can interfere with WiFi.

q152.text: This sounds like a weak signal. When you're close to the router, does it stay connected?

q153.text: Does everyone in your home use the internet heavily at those times (streaming, gaming)?

q154.text: Try restarting your router (unplug for 30 seconds, plug back in). Does it stay connected better?

q200.text: Some websites work but others don't. When a site doesn't load, what do you see?

options.text: Page says 'Can't reach this page' or 'Site can't be reached'
Page says it's blocked or restricted

q201.text: This might be a DNS issue. Can you try accessing google.com? Does it work?

q202.text: The site might be down or very slow. Try a different website. Does that one work?

q203.text: Are the sites that don't work company-specific sites or internal sites?

q250.text: VPN isn't working. When you try to connect, what happens?

options.text: It says 'Connection failed' or times out
It connects but I can't access anything

q251.text: Are you using your correct work username and password? (Same one you use to login to your computer)

q252.text: Are you connected to the internet? Try opening a website to check.

q253.text: VPN is connected but nothing works. This is a routing issue. Do you need help contacting IT?

q254.text: Is your VPN software up to date? Check if there's an update available.

q300.text: Email isn't working. What exactly is the problem?

q301.text: Do you get an error message when trying to send? If yes, what does it say?

q302.text: Have you received ANY emails today, or is it completely silent?

q303.text: What error do you get when logging in?

q304.text: Are you connected to the internet? Try opening a website.

q305.text: Try sending yourself a test email from another account. Do you receive it?

q350.text: Printer isn't working. What happens when you try to print?

options.text: It prints but looks wrong (blank, faded, etc)

q351.text: First, is the printer turned on and showing a ready status? (Check for lights/display)

q354.text: Is the printer on the same WiFi network as your computer? (For wireless printers)

q355.text: Check the printer's display screen for error messages. Can you see anything?

q356.text: Try turning off the printer, waiting 30 seconds, then turning it back on. Does it work now?

q400.text: Video call issues. Which app are you using?

q402.text: Check your speaker volume - is it turned up?

q403.text: Is your microphone muted in the meeting? Look for a microphone icon with a line through it.

q404.text: Have others turned on their cameras? Ask someone to enable their video.

q405.text: Is there a 'Start Video' or camera icon at the bottom? Click it to enable your camera.

q406.text: Is anyone else on your WiFi streaming videos or downloading large files?

q407.text: Check if your computer's microphone is working. Try recording a voice memo or using another app.

q408.text: Does your camera work in other apps (like Photo Booth, Camera app)?

q409.text: Try turning off your video in the call. Does audio quality improve?

q450.text: Can't access shared files. What exactly happens when you try?

q451.text: Are you connected to the company network or VPN? Shared drives usually require this.

q452.text: This is a permissions issue. Have you accessed this folder before?

q453.text: Files might be hidden. In the folder, try pressing Ctrl+H (Windows) or Cmd+Shift+. (Mac) to show hidden files.

q454.text: Try disconnecting and reconnecting to the network drive. Does it appear now?

q500.text: You're connected but have no internet. Do you see a yellow triangle or exclamation mark on your WiFi/network icon?

q501.text: This usually means no IP address or gateway issue. Try disconnecting and reconnecting to WiFi/network.

q502.text: Can other devices on the same network access the internet?

q503.text: We need to renew your IP address. This requires a command. Are you comfortable opening Command Prompt (Windows) or Terminal (Mac)?

q550.text: A website is blocked. What type of message do you see?

q551.text: This site is blocked by your company's security policy. Is this a site you need for work?

q552.text: Does it say the security certificate is invalid or expired?

q600.text: Can't login. What happens when you try?

q601.text: Are you sure Caps Lock is off? Check your keyboard.

q602.text: Are you in the office or working remotely?

q603.text: Try typing your password in Notepad first to make sure it's correct. Does it look right?

q650.text: A network device shows offline. Which type of device is it?

q651.text: First, is the device powered on? Check if it has any lights.

q652.text: Are the lights blinking or solid? What color are they?

q653.text: Check if the network cable is firmly plugged in. Try unplugging and replugging it.

q654.text: Try restarting the device (unplug, wait 30 seconds, plug back in). Does it come back online?

q700.text: IP conflict error. This means two devices have the same IP address. Are you on WiFi or wired?

q701.text: Disconnect from the network, wait 10 seconds, then reconnect. Does the error go away?

sol_no_power.title: Device Has No Power
steps: Check if the power cable is firmly plugged into the device and wall outlet
Try a different power outlet
Check if there's a power switch on the device - make sure it's ON
Look for a blown fuse or tripped circuit breaker
If still no lights, the power adapter may be faulty

sol_router_restart_fixed.title: Problem Resolved After Restart
steps: Great! Your router just needed a restart
In the future, if you have issues, try this first
If you need to restart frequently, consider scheduling automatic reboots

sol_isp_outage.title: Internet Service Provider Outage
steps: Your router appears fine but there's no internet from your ISP
Check your ISP's status page or social media for outage reports
Call your ISP's support number to report the outage
They can check your connection and give you an estimated fix time
Save this number for future reference

sol_cable_loose.title: Cable Connection Issue
steps: Unplug both ends of your network cable completely
Check for any visible damage to the cable
Firmly plug both ends back in until you hear a click
If possible, try a different network cable
You should see a light near the ethernet port when properly connected

sol_cable_reseated.title: Cable Reseated Successfully
steps: Good! The cable just needed to be plugged in properly
Make sure cables aren't being pulled or stretched
Secure the cable with clips if it keeps coming loose

sol_advanced_ethernet.title: Advanced Ethernet Troubleshooting Needed
steps: The physical connection seems fine but there's still an issue
This might be a network adapter or driver problem
Contact IT support for advanced troubleshooting
They may need to check switch port configuration or adapter settings

sol_bandwidth_congestion.title: Too Much Network Usage
steps: Your network is congested - too many people using it at once
Ask others to pause large downloads or streaming temporarily
Close any programs you're not using
Video calls use a lot of bandwidth - consider turning off video
If this happens often, you may need a faster internet plan

sol_contact_isp_speed.title: Contact Your Internet Provider
steps: Your internet is slower than it should be
Contact your ISP and tell them about the slow speeds
They can run remote tests on your connection
There might be a problem with your line or local infrastructure
Ask them to check for outages or maintenance in your area

sol_close_programs.title: Too Many Programs Running
steps: Your computer is running too many things at once
Close browser tabs you're not using
Close programs running in the background
Check for large downloads or updates happening
Restart your computer if it's been on for days

sol_wifi_signal_weak.title: Weak WiFi Signal
steps: Your WiFi signal is too weak
Move closer to the router
Remove obstacles between you and the router (walls, metal objects)
Try elevating the router to a higher position
Consider a WiFi extender for better coverage
Switch to 2.4GHz instead of 5GHz for better range (but slower speed)

sol_device_performance_issue.title: Device Performance Problem
steps: Your device itself might be slow, not just the network
Restart your computer
Check if your hard drive is almost full (need at least 10% free)
Run a virus/malware scan
Check for pending software updates
Consider upgrading if your device is very old

sol_get_wifi_password.title: Get WiFi Password
steps: Check for a sticker on your router - password is often printed there
Check your router's box or manual
Ask someone who previously connected
If you have access to router settings, you can view/reset it there
For office WiFi, contact your IT department

sol_wrong_wifi_password.title: Incorrect WiFi Password
steps: Double-check the password - WiFi passwords are case-sensitive
Make sure you're not typing 'O' (letter) instead of '0' (zero)
Try copying and pasting the password if possible
Have someone else type it to check for errors
If you recently changed your password, use the new one

sol_forget_network_fixed.title: Network Forget Fixed Connection
steps: Great! Forgetting and reconnecting fixed the issue
This clears old saved settings that were causing problems
Your device will remember the correct settings now

sol_wifi_advanced.title: Advanced WiFi Troubleshooting Needed
steps: This is a more complex WiFi issue
Possible causes: MAC address filtering, router capacity limits, or authentication issues
Try connecting to a guest network if available
Contact IT support - they may need to check router settings
Bring another device to confirm the issue is with your device or the network

sol_router_not_broadcasting.title: Router Not Broadcasting WiFi
steps: Your router appears to be working but WiFi might be turned off or hidden
Try connecting with an ethernet cable to access router settings
Check if WiFi broadcasting is enabled in router settings
The SSID (network name) might be hidden - ask IT for the exact name
Restart the router - unplug for 30 seconds then plug back in

sol_wifi_adapter_issue.title: WiFi Adapter Problem
steps: Your computer's WiFi adapter might not be working
Try restarting your computer
Check Device Manager (Windows) for yellow exclamation marks
Update your WiFi drivers
As a temporary fix, use an ethernet cable
Contact IT if the problem persists - might need a USB WiFi adapter

sol_turn_on_wifi.title: Turn On WiFi
steps: Your WiFi is turned off
Look for a physical WiFi switch on your laptop
Try the WiFi function key (usually Fn + F2 or similar)
Check your computer settings - WiFi might be disabled
Turn off Airplane Mode if it's on
Restart your computer if WiFi won't turn on

sol_wifi_interference.title: WiFi Interference Issue
steps: Other devices are interfering with your WiFi signal
Move your router away from microwaves, baby monitors, and cordless phones
Bluetooth devices can also interfere - try turning them off
Try switching to a different WiFi channel in router settings
5GHz WiFi has less interference than 2.4GHz
Consider using wired ethernet for critical connections

sol_dns_issue.title: DNS Resolution Problem
steps: Your computer can't translate website names to addresses
This is usually a temporary issue - try again in a few minutes
Restart your router
If you're comfortable with commands, you can flush DNS cache
Try changing your DNS servers to Google DNS (8.8.8.8)
Contact IT if the problem persists

sol_specific_site_down.title: Specific Website is Down
steps: That particular website appears to be down or having issues
It's not a problem with your internet
Wait a while and try again later
Check if others can access it (use downforeveryoneorjustme.com)
Try accessing from your phone on cellular data to confirm
Clear your browser cache if the site was working before

sol_vpn_needed.title: VPN Connection Required
steps: You need to be connected to your company VPN to access this
Internal company sites are only accessible from the office or through VPN
Connect to your VPN first, then try accessing the site
If you don't have VPN set up, contact IT support
Make sure you're using your work computer or VPN-enabled device

sol_vpn_credentials_wrong.title: VPN Login Credentials Issue
steps: Your VPN username or password might be wrong
Use the same credentials you use to login to your work computer
Check if Caps Lock is on
Your password might have expired - try changing it
Some VPNs require two-factor authentication - check your phone
Contact IT to reset your VPN password if needed

sol_contact_it_vpn.title: Contact IT for VPN Help
steps: This is a more complex VPN configuration issue
VPN is connected but routing isn't working properly
This requires IT support to fix
Contact your IT helpdesk with these details:
- VPN connects successfully
- You can't access internal resources
- Error messages you're seeing

sol_vpn_firewall.title: VPN Blocked by Firewall
steps: Your firewall or security software might be blocking VPN
Try temporarily disabling your firewall/antivirus and connecting
If that works, add an exception for your VPN software
Some public WiFi networks block VPN - try a different network
Contact IT if you need help configuring firewall exceptions

sol_vpn_update_needed.title: VPN Software Needs Update
steps: Your VPN software is out of date
Open your VPN application and check for updates
Download and install any available updates
Restart your computer after updating
Try connecting to VPN again
Contact IT if you can't find or install updates

sol_smtp_issue.title: Email Sending (SMTP) Problem
steps: There's an issue with your outgoing mail server
Check your internet connection
Your email account settings might be wrong
Contact IT support - they need to check your mail server settings
As a workaround, use webmail instead of email client

sol_mailbox_full.title: Mailbox is Full
steps: Your email inbox has reached its storage limit
Delete old emails, especially ones with large attachments
Empty your Deleted Items/Trash folder
Archive old emails to free up space
Contact IT if you need your mailbox quota increased

sol_attachment_too_large.title: Email Attachment Too Large
steps: Your file is too big to send via email (usually limit is 10-25 MB)
Try compressing the file into a .zip
Use a file sharing service instead (OneDrive, Google Drive, SharePoint)
Split large files into multiple smaller parts
Ask the recipient if they have a file transfer service

sol_spam_filter.title: Emails Going to Spam
steps: Check your Spam or Junk mail folder
Mark legitimate emails as 'Not Spam'
Add important senders to your contacts or safe senders list
Check if emails are being forwarded to another folder by rules
Contact IT if you're missing important work emails

sol_email_password_wrong.title: Email Password Incorrect
steps: Your email password is wrong or has changed
Try logging into webmail to verify your password
Your password might have expired - change it
Use the same password you use for your computer login
Some email systems use app-specific passwords - check with IT
Reset your password if you can't remember it

sol_account_locked.title: Account is Locked
steps: Your account has been locked due to too many failed login attempts
Wait 30 minutes and try again
Contact IT support to unlock your account immediately
Make sure you're using the correct password going forward
Consider using a password manager to avoid this

sol_email_server_down.title: Email Server Issue
steps: The email server might be down or having problems
Check if others in your company have the same issue
Try accessing webmail instead of your email client
Wait a while and try again
Contact IT if the problem persists

sol_no_one_emailing_you.title: Email is Working Fine
steps: Your email appears to be working correctly
You're just not receiving emails because no one has sent you any
Check your Sent folder to confirm your test email worked
Your email is functioning normally

sol_email_not_syncing.title: Email Not Syncing
steps: Your email client isn't downloading new messages
Check your internet connection
Try the 'Send/Receive' button to force a sync
Close and reopen your email program
Check if you're in offline mode (look for 'Work Offline' setting)
Remove and re-add your email account if problem persists

sol_printer_off.title: Printer is Turned Off
steps: Your printer is turned off or in sleep mode
Press the power button to turn it on
Wait for it to fully start up (may take 30-60 seconds)
Check if it shows 'Ready' on the display
If it won't turn on, check the power cable

sol_paper_jam.title: Paper Jam
steps: There's paper stuck inside the printer
Turn off the printer first
Open all access doors and trays
Gently pull out any stuck paper - pull in the direction of paper flow
Check for small torn pieces
Close all doors and turn printer back on
Try printing a test page

sol_low_ink.title: Low or Empty Ink/Toner
steps: Your printer is low on ink or toner
Check the printer display for which cartridge needs replacing
Remove and reinsert cartridges to ensure they're seated properly
Replace empty cartridges with new ones
Run a printer cleaning cycle if available
Contact IT if you need replacement cartridges

sol_printer_calibration.title: Printer Needs Calibration
steps: Your printer's colors are off
Run a printer calibration from the settings menu
Print a test page to check colors
Make sure you're using the right paper type
Check if you have genuine ink cartridges (not generic)
Consult your printer manual for calibration instructions

sol_printer_maintenance.title: Printer Needs Maintenance
steps: Your printer needs cleaning
Run the print head cleaning utility (in printer settings)
Clean the printer rollers with a lint-free cloth
Make sure paper isn't dusty or damaged
Check for debris inside the printer
Regular maintenance prevents poor print quality

sol_printer_wrong_network.title: Printer on Wrong Network
steps: Your printer is connected to a different WiFi network
Access printer settings through its display panel
Go to Network or WiFi settings
Connect it to the same network as your computer
You may need to enter the WiFi password
Check printer manual for network setup instructions

sol_check_printer_manual.title: Check Printer Manual
steps: Your printer is showing a specific error code
Write down the exact error code or message
Look up this code in your printer's manual
Search online: [printer model] + [error code]
Contact IT support with the error details if you can't resolve it

sol_restart_printer.title: Restart Printer
steps: Turn off the printer completely
Unplug it from power
Wait 30 seconds
Plug it back in and turn it on
Wait for it to fully initialize
Try printing a test page

sol_printer_restart_fixed.title: Printer Fixed After Restart
steps: Great! Your printer just needed a restart
Printers can have temporary glitches that a restart fixes
If this happens frequently, let IT know

sol_printer_driver_issue.title: Printer Driver Problem
steps: This might be a printer driver or connection issue
Try removing and re-adding the printer
Make sure you have the latest printer drivers
Try printing from a different program to isolate the issue
Contact IT support for advanced printer troubleshooting

sol_check_meeting_audio_settings.title: Check Video Call Audio Settings
steps: Click the audio/microphone settings in your meeting app
Make sure the correct speaker/microphone is selected
Test your audio using the built-in test feature
Try selecting a different audio device
Restart the meeting app if settings don't help

sol_turn_up_volume.title: Turn Up Volume
steps: Your volume is turned down or muted
Check your computer's volume control
Check your speaker volume if using external speakers
Make sure your headphones are plugged in properly
Try pressing the volume up button on your keyboard

sol_unmute_microphone.title: Unmute Your Microphone
steps: You're muted in the meeting
Look for a microphone icon at the bottom of the meeting window
Click it to unmute yourself
Some apps use spacebar to temporarily unmute
Check if there's a red line through the microphone icon

sol_others_camera_off.title: Others Have Cameras Off
steps: The other people in the meeting have their cameras turned off
This is normal - not everyone uses video
You should still be able to hear them
Ask if anyone can turn on their camera to verify

sol_check_video_settings.title: Check Video Settings
steps: Click video settings in your meeting app
Make sure the correct camera is selected
Test your video using the built-in preview
Try selecting a different camera if you have multiple
Restart the meeting app if settings don't work

sol_camera_permission_denied.title: Camera Permission Denied
steps: Your video app doesn't have permission to use your camera
On Mac: System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Camera
On Windows: Settings > Privacy > Camera
Enable permission for your meeting app
Restart the app after enabling permission

sol_bandwidth_video_call.title: Not Enough Bandwidth for Video
steps: Your internet can't handle video calls right now
Ask others to pause streaming or downloads
Turn off your own video but keep audio on
Close other programs using the internet
Move closer to the WiFi router
Consider using phone audio if call quality is critical

sol_microphone_not_working.title: Microphone Hardware Issue
steps: Your microphone isn't working at all
Check if it's plugged in properly (if external)
Try a different USB port
Test with headphones that have a built-in mic
Check sound settings to ensure mic isn't disabled
Contact IT if your built-in microphone doesn't work

sol_camera_hardware_issue.title: Camera Hardware Problem
steps: Your camera appears to have a hardware issue
Check if there's a physical camera privacy switch/cover
Try an external USB webcam as a workaround
Update your camera drivers
Contact IT support - your camera may need repair

sol_disable_video_for_better_call.title: Disable Video for Better Quality
steps: Video is using too much bandwidth
Turn off your video to improve audio quality
Ask others to turn off video if call is still poor
Audio-only calls use much less bandwidth
Consider this for important calls with poor connection

sol_internet_too_slow_calls.title: Internet Too Slow for Video Calls
steps: Your internet connection is too slow for reliable video calls
Minimum recommended: 3 Mbps for video calls
Consider upgrading your internet plan
Use a wired ethernet connection instead of WiFi
Close all other programs and browser tabs
As last resort, use phone audio and dial in

sol_connect_vpn_first.title: Connect to VPN First
steps: You need to be on VPN to access this resource
Connect to your company VPN before trying again
Internal files and drives require VPN when working remotely
If you don't have VPN set up, contact IT support

sol_permissions_changed.title: File Permissions Changed
steps: Your access permissions may have been changed
Contact the file/folder owner to request access
Contact IT if you should have access but don't
Your job role may have changed affecting access
Provide specific file path when contacting IT

sol_request_access.title: Request File Access
steps: You don't currently have permission to access this
Contact the file owner and ask for access
Explain what you need to do with the files
Contact IT if you're not sure who the owner is
You may need manager approval for sensitive files

sol_files_were_hidden.title: Files Were Hidden
steps: The files were hidden
You can now see them with hidden files shown
To permanently show hidden files:
Windows: File Explorer > View > Show hidden files
Mac: Press Cmd+Shift+. in Finder

sol_wrong_folder.title: Wrong Folder or Path
steps: You might be looking in the wrong location
Verify the correct folder path with someone who has access
Check if the files were moved to a different location
Use the search function to find the files
Contact the person who told you about the files

sol_drive_remounted.title: Network Drive Reconnected
steps: Great! Reconnecting the drive fixed the issue
The connection just needed to be refreshed
If this happens frequently, let IT know

sol_contact_it_shares.title: Contact IT for Shared Files Help
steps: This is a more complex network share issue
Contact IT support with these details:
- What drive/folder you're trying to access
- Exact error message
- Whether you had access before
They may need to check server or permission settings

sol_reconnect_fixed.title: Reconnecting Fixed the Issue
steps: Great! Simply reconnecting fixed the problem
Sometimes network settings get stuck
If this happens regularly, let IT know

sol_renew_ip.title: Renew IP Address
steps: You need to get a new IP address from your router
Windows: Open Command Prompt and type these commands:
ipconfig /release
ipconfig /renew
Mac: Open Terminal and type:
sudo ipconfig set en0 DHCP
Wait 30 seconds between commands
If this doesn't work, contact IT support

sol_contact_it_no_ip.title: Contact IT for IP Address Issue
steps: You're not getting an IP address from the network
This might be a DHCP server issue
Contact IT support - they need to check the network
Mention you have 'no internet access' and tried reconnecting
This usually requires network administrator help

sol_request_website_unblock.title: Request Website Unblock
steps: This website is blocked by company security policy
If you need it for work, submit a request to IT:
- Explain why you need access
- Provide business justification
- Manager approval may be required
IT will review and may grant access if appropriate

sol_site_blocked_policy.title: Site Blocked by Company Policy
steps: This website is blocked by your company's internet policy
This is usually for security or productivity reasons
Common blocked categories: social media, gaming, adult content
If you need it for work, submit an unblock request to IT
Personal browsing should be done on personal devices/networks

sol_certificate_warning.title: Security Certificate Warning
steps: The website's security certificate is invalid or expired
This could indicate a security risk
Do NOT proceed if this is a financial or sensitive site
For internal company sites, contact IT - certificate may need renewal
For public sites, they may be having temporary issues
Never enter passwords on sites with certificate errors

sol_malicious_site_warning.title: Malicious Site Warning
steps: Your security software has flagged this site as dangerous
DO NOT proceed to this site
The site may contain malware, phishing, or scams
If you think this is a mistake, contact IT
Never disable security warnings to access a site
Report suspicious sites to IT security team

sol_caps_lock_on.title: Caps Lock is On
steps: Your Caps Lock key is turned on
Press the Caps Lock key to turn it off
Passwords are case-sensitive
Look for a Caps Lock indicator light on your keyboard
Try logging in again with Caps Lock off

sol_check_network_cable.title: Check Network Connection
steps: Your computer can't reach the company network
Check if your network cable is plugged in
Make sure you're connected to the company WiFi
Try connecting with ethernet cable if using WiFi
You may need to restart your computer
Contact IT if you still can't login

sol_password_expired.title: Password May Be Expired
steps: Your password might have expired
Most companies require password changes every 60-90 days
You should have received an expiration warning
Try the password reset process
Contact IT if you can't reset it yourself
Have your employee ID ready when calling IT

sol_password_reset_needed.title: Password Reset Required
steps: You need to reset your password
Use your company's self-service password reset tool if available
You'll usually need to answer security questions
Contact IT helpdesk if self-service doesn't work
Have your employee ID ready
Once reset, use new password everywhere (email, VPN, etc.)

sol_keyboard_not_working.title: Keyboard Not Working
steps: Your keyboard isn't responding
Check if it's plugged in (for wired keyboards)
Check batteries (for wireless keyboards)
Try a different USB port
Restart your computer
Try an on-screen keyboard to login temporarily
Contact IT for a replacement keyboard if needed

sol_device_no_power.title: Network Device Has No Power
steps: The device has no power
Check if it's plugged into a working outlet
Check if there's a power switch - make sure it's ON
Try a different power outlet
Check the power adapter/cable for damage
The device may have failed - contact IT for replacement

sol_device_error_state.title: Device in Error State
steps: The device is showing error lights
Red or amber lights usually indicate a problem
Try restarting the device (unplug 30 seconds, replug)
Check if any cables are loose
Note the exact light pattern (blinking, solid, colors)
Contact IT with the light pattern information

sol_device_restart_fixed.title: Device Fixed After Restart
steps: Great! The device just needed a restart
Network devices can have temporary glitches
If this happens frequently, let IT know
The device may need firmware updates

sol_contact_it_device_offline.title: Contact IT for Offline Device
steps: The device isn't coming back online
This requires IT support to investigate
Provide these details when contacting IT:
- Device type and location
- Status of lights
- What you've tried
- How long it's been offline
They may need to physically check the device

sol_ip_conflict_resolved.title: IP Conflict Resolved
steps: Great! The IP conflict is resolved
Your device got a new IP address
This happens when two devices have the same IP
If it happens again, let IT know

sol_static_ip_conflict.title: Static IP Conflict
steps: You have a persistent IP conflict
Someone may have manually set an IP address
This requires IT support to fix
Contact IT and mention 'IP address conflict'
They'll need to check your network settings
Do not manually change IP settings without IT approval
